intro: Hellenia borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean hellenia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
